title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Health officials around the U.S. resumed offering J&J's Covid-19 vaccine after getting a green light from federal regulators.

Top health officials warned that vaccine hesitancy posed a risk to getting enough Americans inoculated to stop the spread of Covid-19, and they encouraged individuals to get vaccinated.

---

Two centrist senators key to negotiations over infrastructure spending signaled progress in talks but made clear they don't support Biden's expansive $2.3 trillion proposal.

---

Biden formally declared the massacres of Armenians in the early 20th century to be genocide, fulfilling a campaign promise that is likely to worsen growing tensions with Turkey.

---

Exploding oxygen canisters sparked a fire that engulfed a Baghdad hospital treating Covid-19 patients, killing at least 82 people, Iraqi officials said.

---

Louisiana lawmaker Troy Carter won a runoff election for Congress that boosted the Democratic Party's slim majority in the House.

---

Ambitious global emissions goals come with staggering costs and looming political battles, climate analysts and economists say.
